column4: i wanted to trasnfer some of the 68GB of unallocated to my sda4. But there seems no easy way out
because the current sda4 space is limited which is 20GB and only left few GB..i plan to find ways to absorb some unalocated space to there
any thing i could do currently to do that

moutn which dirve? the unaalocated space?
mount as a new drive arghh2d2?
means i will have 20GB as one drive (sda4) and another 68GB as another drive
is that formatting them using gparted?
adding it to fstab is easy
, you cant send partition space to anothe drive
what do you need the new space for? system files or storage?
well format it first if you havent already
thats what i dont understand...you CANNOT put free space from one drive to another drive, it's not a virtual filesystem
